TEI.2.document_title: J. Thomas to Stephen F. Austin, 09-20-1824

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 898-899

div1.p: Russel H McWaters and his brother in law Mr Samuel Fulton- two intimate friends of mine have determined to visit your ctry. Their views like those of many others are not very definite—Tho well situated here I presume they would locate themselves with you should the prospect be as flattering as they anticipate. These young men are not only respectable themselves, but are members of a numerous, wealthy and respectable connexion.
Should they become your neighbours I feel assured, that you will not regret any favor that you may think proper to extend to them.
